content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Here is how you can write such a function in Julia:

```julia
function keep_only_names(words)
    return [word for word in words if first(word) == uppercase(first(word))]
end
```
The function `keep_only_names` uses a list comprehension to iterate over the provided list of words (`words`). For each word, it checks whether the first character of the word is equal to its uppercase version. If true, it includes that word in the new list; otherwise, it excludes it.

Note: `first(word)` gets the first character of a string and `uppercase(first(word))` converts it into uppercase. Also, `==` operator checks for equality of two strings. 

This function will only keep words that start with a capital letter (like "Dog", "Cat" etc.).
